item.title: How to read a paper
item.description: How to read a paper - Three-pass approach # Note: This is my own digest of [1] and is kept as a reference for future readings. Problem: The author presents the problem of students having difficulty reading research papers. Contribution: The author presents the “three-pass” approach. Pass 1 # Do the following: Read title, abstract and introduction. Read section and sub-sections headings. Read conclusion. To understand the “five-Cs”:

item.title: How to read a paper
item.description: About this… # Website containing various reading notes and summaries. Topics are mainly (but not limited to) computer science/programming in general and digests of scientific literature from my reading list. It’s intended to be useful for me primarly. I’m making those pages public with the hopes that this might be useful to someone else. Since I am human with human flaws, you might encounter some mistake or inconsistencies. If you do so or have any comments/suggestions/threats, please open an issue at https://github.
